body.p:
Midway December 14th 1861
To His excellency
The Honorable Beriah Magoffin governor of the Commonwealth of kentucky

you petitioners would Respectfully implore your Clemency in the case of John Ryan and peter senate. convicted and fined 50 Dollars and cost ^each^ for selling whiskey to slaves ^in the Town of Midway, Woodford County^ your petitioners Have every Reason to believe. that the object of the informers ^is^ to make money and it was proven that Ryan was not at Home and His wife give the whiskey the negro. presing His mision. as one of necesity.. Mr Ryan is a poor man the father of seven children. and is now in jail. would pay the fine if posible. but Has not the means, His wife is in Bad Health, expecting confinement every Day, and they are Distitute. His labor being all the support. we earnestly beseech your excellency. as an act of Humanity, and Charity. to Remit the above fines

Wm. N. Thomasson
Wm Buford
John Coyle
J. H. Sheets
W F Harper
James Ford owner of Slave
The above is a true sate of the case

Midway Po. Ct
$50. each } liquor to slaves
Jno. Ryan
Peter Senate
Issd Decr. 13. 1861
